intro: Micrantheum demissum, commonly known as the low-growing marsh plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and slender, often prostrate stems. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Micrantheum demissum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in environments with high humidity and limited sunlight.
